page.title: 14MAPPERLEY
page.content: {MAPPERLEY Mapperley is mainly known for the reservoir which provides water for many homes. The reservoir is 38 feet deep in the centre. The reservoir covers alot of land. At the moment work is going on to plant a new valve in the water, but first they have to find the old valve. There are several farms around Mapperley, one of them is called White House Farm. Their land is grazing land, rough grazing land, the surrounding woodland is dominated by deciduous trees. The land is now owned by the National Coal Board and will become an opencast site in the coming years. There's a small park called Mapperley Park which has a riding school on it, a campsite, golf course, miniature, steam railway and many other things, there is a house nearby where the ranger lives.
